summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeKenra Platinum Silkening Heat Crème reduces hot tool passes by 50% for the same sleek style with less damage in half the time. This thermal protectant features Sacha Inchi, a nutrient-dense nut oil, to prevent breakage and improve manageability for silky brilliant strands.
details: DetailsBenefitsProvides thermal protection up to 450 degrees FReduces hot tool passes by half for reduced styling timeItem 2550547How To UseDepending on hair length and density, apply 1-3 pumps to dry hair from mid-lengths to ends and style with hot tool. For a polished end result, finish style with an additional pump; focusing on ends.Precautions: Avoid eye contact. For external use only. In the event of an adverse reaction, discontinue use and contact a physician immediately. Keep out of reach of children.IngredientsWater/Aqua/Eau, Glycerin, Dimethicone, Cetyl Alcohol, Glyceryl Stearate, Peg-100 Stearate, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Phenoxyethanol, Bis-Diisopropanolamino-Pg-Propyl Dimethicone/Bis-Isobutyl Peg-14 Copolymer, Fragrance/Parfum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Polysorbate 20, Butyloctanol, Benzyl Benzoate, Camellia Oleifera Seed Oil, Disodium Phosphate, Polysorbate 60, Hexyl Cinnamal, Methyl 2-Octynoate, Limonene, Linalool, Sodium Phosphate, Hydrolyzed Plukenetia Volubilis Seed Extract.
how_to_use: Depending on hair length and density, apply 1-3 pumps to dry hair from mid-lengths to ends and style with hot tool. For a polished end result, finish style with an additional pump; focusing on ends.Precautions: Avoid eye contact. For external use only. In the event of an adverse reaction, discontinue use and contact a physician immediately. Keep out of reach of children.

reviews.headline: Great for frizz
reviews.comments: Awesome product to battle frizz!!!

reviews.headline: Heavenly Heat Protectant
reviews.comments: I LOVE THIS CREME!! Blow drying is so easy now! I have dense, type 4b hair,  and this slid through it like butter! So smooth and silky - and it cut my blow dry time in half! Marvelous product!!

reviews.headline: Smell
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this product…until heat gets involved. It smells so good at first and adds silkiness to your hair, but as soon as you apply heat to your hair it goes all wrong. Then every time you turn on the hot tool after the smell returns until you clean it all off. Basically unuseable as a heat protectant because of the horrible smell.

reviews.headline: Highly recommend
reviews.comments: I have 4c texture hair, and I apply some before blow drying. It smells so good, and make my hair feel so soft afterwards. I love it.

reviews.headline: Reduced drying time
reviews.comments: I have very thick hair and I have struggled to find a product to help reduce my drying time.  I'm impessed by how quickly I saw results.  I love how this product has helped smooth my hair as well. I would definitely recommend this!

reviews.headline: Silky soft result and protection from heat and humidity
reviews.comments: This product was recommended to me by my hair dresser. I absolutely love this product before using a curling iron. It feels almost like a hair serum, and I do think that it reduces frizz and protects from humidity. Leaves my hair feeling so soft and shiny.

reviews.headline: Softens AND Protects
reviews.comments: My hair is very wiry, thin, brittle, and prone to breakage. Left completely natural, it looks like worn out steel wool that has started to unravel, feels like very thin straw, and seems to shed more than my corgi in summer. When flat ironed without product, it kind of just lays flat with no movement. So naturally, I've decided to try and grow it out shoulder length. My reviews are based on how products have helped or hindered that effort, and may not be applicable to your hair type. This product has been a God send!!!! There are certainly other heat protection treatments that are effective, but this one has done miracles for my hair. It is softer, smoother, silkier, and stronger. I've noticed a massive reduction in breakage.

reviews.headline: THE BEST
reviews.comments: My hair has never felt softer or shinier!! Highly recommend!!!

reviews.headline: I love this now...
reviews.comments:
it took several uses before I figured out how to use it. Basically,  I wasn't putting enough on at first. And I didn't see any results.  I put this on just before my hair is completely dry.  I section my hair into 3 parts.... left, right and back.  3 to 4 pumps per section. I have fine hair but a lot of it,  below my shoulders.  I have 2C to 3A hair and blow it straight most of the time. This stuff is amazing! (Once you figure out how much to use.)  My hair is super soft, straight, shiny and beautiful. Doesn't feel like there is anything in my hair. No stiffness or product flaking. Helps with humidity. 
I definitely recommend trying this product.

reviews.headline: Impressed!
reviews.comments: I have straight hair but blow dry and flat iron. It can become frizzy, especially in the humid months. I've tried multiple products for heat protection and smoothing. I finally found the IT product!  I was skeptical of using cream on dry hair. Wouldn't it just leave a gross residue on my hair? Nope! And a little goes a long way! It smells amazing and it leaves my hair shiny and smooth with a flat iron. And best of all, it's a heat protectant too! It's worth the try!

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: Good product. Expensive though.

reviews.headline: Good product
reviews.comments: Good product. It's a bit out of my budget though.

reviews.headline: Amazing Heat Protectant
reviews.comments: Tried this out for the first time with my flat-iron. Very easy to use, a little bit goes a long way! It also smells like Jolly Ranchers which is a bonus, lol. Makes such a huge difference in my hair after heat styling. My hair is softer, smoother, shinier, and I love it! Will definitely keep this in my routine. Love Kenra!

reviews.headline: Not Worth It for Curly Hair 3C and Above
reviews.comments: Did nothing for my hair. No hold, no shine, I don't even think it protects it from heat. Useless.

reviews.headline: Shocked
reviews.comments: I did not expect to love this as much as I did! I have been looking for a heat protectant that works well on dry hair and this is IT. It didn't feel sticky, smells great, and left my hair feeling smooth and shiny! I have very thick curly hair and even still a little goes a long way. I normally use the ColorWow Dream Coat which is still great, but it feels better on wet hair than dry. This is my new go to!

reviews.headline: A product from heaven!
reviews.comments: I am completely hooked on this product nothing gets my hair a silky smooth as this, not only that it protects my hair from damage when heat styling. My hair looks as though I left the salon every time I use it!

reviews.headline: Thank you, Jesus!
reviews.comments: Finally, I product that turns my 3C hair into soft, manageable, frizz free hair

reviews.headline: first time
reviews.comments: First time trying this product, i've only used it once but for the looks of it, it works really good on my curly hair.

reviews.headline: Great protectant
reviews.comments: Nothing to complain about with this product! I very very long hair and a little of this goes a long way. Smells amazing and doesn't leave hair feeling greasy. Soft and silky whether my hair is straight, curly (still holding curls) or wavy.

reviews.headline: Product
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this product! I have been using so many products for years and nothing compares to this one! I will continue to buy. Leaves hair shiny and beautiful!

properties.name: Cons

values.label: Hair is sticky very dry and not brushable

display_values: Hair is sticky very dry and not brushable

media.headline: So silky
media.caption: The shine on my hair is incredible!

media.headline: Kenra sickening heat creme
media.caption: I used kenra silkening heat creme

faceoff_positive.comments: I have crazy thick frizzy hair so if I'm not careful, blow drying my hair can be a disaster. I always need a couple of products, starting with a heat protectant serum then a smoothing serum and sometimes a leave in conditioner. When I used this silkening heat creme I was able to cut a bunch of hair products down to one amazing product. I am super happy with the results and will continue to use this every time I blow dry my hair in the future.
faceoff_positive.headline: Hair serum!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I have type 4 hair with medium-coarse strand thickness and this didn't do much for me. 
Was it softening? Yes. 
Did it add shine? A little, but it didn't add much more than any other creamy/oily heat protectant. I also always use a serum afterwards that does a better job of adding shine anyway. 
Does it smell badly? Not to me. I actually like the scent. It's fruity, but I can see how it might not mix with the scents of other products. It disappears pretty quickly anyway. 

I've used this product about 5 times sporadically and my issue with it is how quickly my hair puffed up every time I used it. It would barely last a day inside the house before it started getting mega volume and puffiness. I like that look, but I also care about the longevity of the style and don't want frizz in the first week, let alone the first day. My hair is decently resistant because of the coarseness and the fact that I don't mess up its integrity by doing crazy stuff to it or my scalp (no crazy/unstable DIY hair products with pH imbalances; no tight styles; no leaving my hair wet all day because that weakens the strength of the hair strands; I prevent my hair from tangling/matting; I clarify and exfoliate my scalp every wash; I keep my scalp clear of product, etc). Because of this and knowing how to use heat properly, I have been able to do back to back silk presses every 2-4 weeks and heat touch ups in between for the past year and a half with no curl loosening, so I guess I need to stick with heat protectants that have hold. 

With that being said, I've used heat protectants without hold before and never had puffy hair that quickly. I feel the issue with this is the glycerin. Glycerin is a humectant and pulls moisture from the air into the hair. And with glycerin being the second ingredient, I think it attracted humidity to my hair and facilitated the puffiness. I feel like this is for people with thinner and straighter hair so they can have hair that's straight but not flat. Maybe this wouldn't be as bad for me to use during the winter, but there are other no hold, alcohol free heat protectants on the market that are cheaper and don't have glycerin.
faceoff_negative.headline: Puff City
